pyproct.algorithms.gromos.parametersGeneration module¶

Created on 27/05/2013

@author: victor

class pyproct.algorithms.gromos.parametersGeneration.ParametersGenerator(parameters, matrix_handler)[source]¶

Bases: object

GROMOS_DEFAULT_MAX = 25¶
classmethod get_base_parameters()[source]¶

Defines the base parameters needed for each of the algorithms. Each parameter created will be based on one of those and must not have more keys than these.

@return: A dictionary with the base parameters for this algorithm.

get_most_separated_elements()[source]¶

Chooses the 2 most separated elements of the dataset based on the distance stored in distance matrix. @return: A dictionary with the elements and their distance value.

get_most_separated_from_two_elements(first, second)[source]¶

Gets the element which distance to two elements is maximum.

@param first: First element to check against. @param second: Second element to check against.

@return: A dictionary with the number of element and the

get_parameters()[source]¶

This function creates some parameters to be used with Gromos. @return: A tuple with the generated parameters and an empty list corresponding to the clusterings.
